intro: Ditassa mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, orange or yellow berries that contain seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
